description: In May 2021 Gabriele Gramelsberger (Theory of Science and Technology) and Stefan Böschen (Sociology of Technology) founded the Käte Hamburger Kolleg "Cultures of Research" – an International Center of Advanced Studies for History, Philosophy, and Sociology of Science and Technology. Every year more than ten international fellows are invited to join the Kolleg for a one-year stay.

Fellows have been Amanda Boetzkes (University of Guelph), Steve Fuller (Warwick University), Frederik Stjernfelt (Aalborg University Copenhagen), Alexandre Hocquet (Laboratory Archives Henri-Poincaré), Andoni Ibarra (University of the Basque Country), Roland Wittje (Indian Institute of Technology Madras), Benjamin Peters (University of Tulsa), Masahiko Hara (Tokyo Tech), Bart Penders (University of Maastricht), Nelson Zavale (Eduardo Mondlane University Mozambique), and many more.

Scientific Advisory Board of the Kolleg: Hans-Jörg Rheinberger (MPI for History of Science Berlin), Ad Aertsen (Bernstein Center Freiburg), Pierre Delvenne (Spiral University of Liège), Sabine Maasen (University of Hamburg), Mary S. Morgan (London School of Economics), Lars Nielsen (University of Queensland), Alfred Nordmann (TU Darmstadt), Franck Varenne (University of Rouen and CNRS-Lab IHPST Paris), Harro van Lente (Maastricht University).
The Kolleg is funded by the German Ministry of Research and Education. It is located at the Theaterstrasse 75 (Stadtpalais), Aachen.
